posts.title: JavaScript data types and data structures
posts.span: Programming languages all have built-in data structures, but these often differ from one language to another.
posts.description: This article attempts to list the built-in data structures available in JavaScript and what properties they have. These can be used to build other data structures. Wherever possible, comparisons with other languages are drawn.
posts.descriptionSubSection: JavaScript is a loosely typed and dynamic language. Variables in JavaScript are not directly associated with any particular value type, and any variable can be assigned (and re-assigned) values of all types:
